clinical_study.brief_title: Locally Delivered Aloe Vera Gel in the Treatment of Chronic Periodontitis Patients With Diabetes Mellitus
clinical_study.official_title: Local Drug Delivery of Aloe Vera Gel in Chronic Periodontitis Patients With Controlled Diabetes Mellitus

lead_sponsor.agency: Dr. D. Y. Patil Dental College & Hospital

clinical_study.source: Dr. D. Y. Patil Dental College & Hospital

brief_summary.textblock: A study on the effect of locally delivered aloe vera gel as an adjunct to scaling and root planing in the treatment of chronic periodontitis patients with controlled type II diabetes mellitus.The evaluation of Plaque Index, Gingival Index, Probing Pocket Depth, Relative Attachment Level at baseline, 6 weeks and 3 months and Glycosylated heamoglobin at baseline and 3 months.

detailed_description.textblock:
Aloe vera gel was locally delivered in the periodontal pockets of ≥ 5mm bilaterally in chronic periodontitis patients with diabetes under control.(HbA1c-6.6-8.6%).The study design had two groups-one in which scaling and root planing and local delivery of aloe vera gel and the other only scaling and root planing.
The evaluation of clinical parameters of PI, GI, PPD and RAL at baseline, 6 weeks and 3 months.
HbA1c evaluated at baseline and 3 months.

primary_outcome.measure: Clinical parameter of probing pocket depth
primary_outcome.description: Clinically change in the probing pocket depth.

secondary_outcome.description: HbA1c levels evaluated at baseline and 3 months

secondary_outcome.measure: Clinical parameter of relative attachment level
secondary_outcome.description: Change in the relative attachment level.

arm_group.description: Scaling and root planing was done along with application of aloe vera gel as an adjunct in selected sites.
Only scaling and root planing was done on the opposite side.

intervention.description: Scaling and root planing along with aloe vera application was done
Scaling and root planing was done

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Patients age 30 - 55 years from both genders.
2. Patients with controlled Type II Diabetes Mellitus (HbA1c < 7%) with Chronic periodontitis having ≥ 5mm periodontal pockets bilaterally atleast in one site.
3. Patients on oral hypoglycaemic agents.
4. Subjects who have not received periodontal therapy within preceding 6 months.
5. Patients willing to comply with all study related procedures.
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Subjects who have received antibiotic treatment in the preceding 3 months.
2. History of prolonged use of antibiotics/ steroids/ immunosuppressive agents /aspirin/ anticoagulants/ other medications including any other herbal products.
3. Pregnant or lactating women.
4. Smokers.
5. History of systemic diseases like hypertension, HIV, bone metabolic disorders, radiation therapy, Osteoporosis, immunosuppressive therapy, cancer etc.other than Diabetes.
6. Unwilling patients
